title: 7. What Happens to Patients When Thousands of Cardiologists Leave Town?
description: This week, Bapu Jena presents some hot-off-the-presses research exploring the relationship between how many patients a doctor sees, and how well those patients do. Plus, the surprising impact of annual cardiology conferences that prompted Bapu’s first conversation with Stephen Dubner on Freakonomics Radio.
author: bapu@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
